abstract.p: Envoy Communications Group is acquiring Hampel/Stefanides (S)

block.p: The agency world is getting smaller again as another independent shop is being acquired.

Envoy Communications Group in Toronto, which owns the Canadian agency Communique, is expanding to the United States by buying Hampel/Stefanides in New York. Financial terms of the deal, to be formally announced today, were not disclosed.
The agency world is getting smaller again as another independent shop is being acquired.

Envoy Communications Group in Toronto, which owns the Canadian agency Communique, is expanding to the United States by buying Hampel/Stefanides in New York. Financial terms of the deal, to be formally announced today, were not disclosed.

Hampel/Stefanides, founded in 1993, will continue to operate as an autonomous agency under that name. The present management team -- Larry Hampel, 39, president, and Dean Stefanides, 43, and Brian Goodall, 50, co-creative directors -- will continue in those roles.
Hampel/Stefanides has had ''many opportunities to do a deal,'' Mr. Goodall said, but selected Envoy because it offered clients access to integrated marketing services like Web site design.

Hampel/Stefanides, which also has an office in San Francisco, has 60 employees and billings estimated at $110 million from clients like Aer Lingus. Envoy agencies have 175 employees and billings estimated at $75 million (United States) from clients like Adidas.
